name: recontamination
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of making something dirty, infected, or poisonous again, for a second, third, etc. time: The cans are then sealed hermetically to prevent recontamination through poorly made seams. The only possible source of recontamination is airborne, which can be generally discounted.
More examplesFewer examplesAnother factor which makes treatment difficult is recontamination of the nail, since the fungus may thrive in the warm, moist environment found inside shoes.After the initial food processing, ready-to-eat meats are also vulnerable to recontamination by pathogenic bacteria.The most likely areas of recontamination are places like gravel driveways, where contaminated soil picked up from car tyres can fall.
